file_content.text: You are a great warrior.
I've proven my strength. Will you join my Alliance?
Quite a compliment, coming from you.
I know.
I cannot defy you. Do as you will.
You have become strong, Xalek, but I am still the master here.
Yes, lord.
I am feeling merciful, under the circumstances. Renew your pledge to me and all is forgiven.
My life is yours, lord.
[Punish Xalek] This is the price of disobedience.
Argh!
I beg forgiveness, lord.
I am your will given form.
Godhood escapes me and my father both.
Sorry. Honor your father in some other way.
I am beaten and unworthy of him.
All that remains is you finish me.
I'd rather not kill you. I need strength like yours in my Alliance.
Then I will serve, so that I may be remembered.
I am Xalek. You may command me.
[Kill Xalek] If that's how you want it.
[Kill Xalek] Justice for those you've murdered.
Argh!
Stars, it's over. Thank you! Thank you, thank you, thank you. I thought we were dead.
Greed nearly cost you the lives of everyone here.
Believe me, headquarters is going to get an earful about this. I'll never even dig near an old camp site again!
You should be safe now.
It was a miracle someone like you heard our distress signal. I don't know what we'd have done otherwise.
I expect more than your gratitude.
Oh, um, of course. I can, uh, get some credits... or some crystals--uh, how about both. Let's just go with that!
Thank you for everything.
[Shock Him] Shut up.
Ahh!
No, no, no, no, no.... Please!
Stop!
Do not interfere.
Why are you doing this?
It is my duty.
Hasn't a Sith got better things to do?
Duty before glory.
Slim pickings for a Sith. Why bother?
These people seem beneath you.
Their weakness only offers further insult.
Xalek?
The Force spoke true.
Slaughtering the helpless? That hardly seems like you.
I take no satisfaction from it.
I'd know that presence anywhere. You've been busy, my apprentice.
I thought the feeling was from within.
Lord, we cannot speak now.
I must kill them.
Don't let him... please. I'm beg--
Quiet!
Why? Answer me!
They have defiled a sacred burial.
Why, Xalek?
[Datapads Collected] The shrine they demolished. It was a grave, wasn't it?
That is so.
[Datapads Collected] They defiled your father's shrine, didn't they?
Desecrated and robbed his dignity.
I'm not going to stand by and watch you kill innocent people.
Innocent? There is no forgiving their crimes.
My father's bones lay cast aside. His face adorns a mantel. No Kaleesh could call him god now.
I'm sorry.
They should have to pay for that, but not with their lives.
That is all they can pay with.
Well, foreman, it looks like you brought this on yourselves.
I'm sorry! We're all sorry! We didn't know! The company has resources. They can make reparations!
If you kill them, will that be the end of this?
They have desecrated the shrine of my father. When he rests once more, then it may end.
Their blood is the only offering that will slake my father's vengeance. Enshrined with their bones, his godhood may be restored.
What if they restored his shrine? Built something grander than any Kaleesh before? Would that see your father's honor restored?
Corporations are loaded. What if they rebuilt your dad's shrine even bigger and better than before?
A temple for his veneration?
Yes--yes! Headquarters would have to agree to it. It'd be a nightmare for them if this got out.
Do not speak again.
Make my father whole and return him to a place befitting a god. Your lives depend on it.
You have my blessing, Xalek. Let this anger give you strength.
Very well, do what your duty demands of you.
This is personal. I get it. Do what you've gotta do.
I shall.
It's not your father's desires that matter, Xalek, only mine. I will not share allegiance with a corpse.
You have not been master of me for some time.
So you'd kill scores of people for the honor of a dead man? That ends now.
It ends when my father is whole.
Yeah, I'm not letting you kill these people because of your crazy religion.
Then you will meet death.
Kill them and be done with it. I have need of you again.
Thank you, lord.
No! Why? Ahhh!
My father will know peace again soon.
I have honored your legacy as well, lord.
As you should, apprentice.
That is not a name for me now.
I am fortunate to have so loyal a servant.
Loyalty is earned.
I hope you've done more than slaughter weaklings in my honor.
There are legions that fear my name and know whom I serve.
I have enjoyed freedom as a lord of the Sith. I would kneel again for a lord such as you.
Come, Xalek. We have much to do.
As you wish, lord.
You need not kneel to me, but I would call you ally once more.
Then I will follow.
Then kneel.
Yes, lord.
Is it respect for the dead that stays my enemy's hand?
I'd like to be your ally instead of your enemy. Your mastery of the Force would be useful.
You are a great warrior and Sith. What do you seek here?
Why are you here?
I lead an Alliance against the Eternal Empire. I want to know if you'll join it.
Their distress call mentioned a powerful Sith. I need powerful Sith.
I am bound to no one.
You seek to command me. You must make me kneel.
A duel then.
I will give you a warrior's death.
[Reject Companion] I don't want a fight, Xalek.
Then I have nothing more to say.
Anyone out there? Hello! Please, someone answer!
Who is this, what's the situation?
Anna, at shaft twelve.
Are you with the mining operations here?
Yes! Yes, this is shaft twelve.
What are you screaming about?
He's here! Shaft twelve! I need help!
We can't reach base camp! That monster... he's killed everyone outside the tunnels. He's just waiting at the mouth, pacing. We're trapped!
Oh--I think he heard me. He's coming! Help, please, help!
Shaft sixteen is abandoned right now, don't trust anyone sneaking around there.
You're back! Are you going to help stop that madman before he kills us all?
Yes. I'll help you.
[Refuse Quest] That's not a priority for me.
Still no word from shaft twelve. Atmospherics are bad... maybe--
Keep trying them! Just... keep trying. I'm not losing anyone else out there.
A Jedi? Oh, thank you, someone's been listening at least.
Your distress call sounded urgent. Something about a Sith preying on you?
I'm sorry I didn't hear of your troubles sooner.
Master Jedi, we're lucky to have you at all.
Why haven't you evacuated?
I... Well, there are hundreds of workers--at dozens of camps. I'm not sure we can recall them safely with that madman on the loose.
Finally, the Republic responds to our distress calls. I know there's a war out there, but we're putting more into the ground than taking out.
I'm not here in an official capacity, but I am here about your distress call.
Oh... did you bring more? I mean, I'm happy to have volunteers, but I'm not sure a few soldiers will be enough.
What do you mean by that?
I don't mean it literally; we gather the dead and return them to their families. There have been so many....
Most civilians might take that as a clue that they don't belong here.
We're far from the fighting. We're authorized to be here under both governments. There's no accounting for madmen!
If you've come for the next shipment, there isn't one. We've got a crisis on our hands--actually, how much to stand by for an evacuation?
You're welcome to load my ship with crystals, but I came about the distress call.
Well, that's something anyway. Even so, I'm not really sure I can recall my people safely. There's no security left to protect them.
Be happy to work something out, but what's got you so spooked?
You don't know what's going on? You didn't hear the distress call?
You're outta luck, my ship's docked in orbit.
Dammit.... Wishful thinking anyway. They'd string me up for leaving our people behind.
Ahh! Oh--I'm sorry. You startled me... there's a killer out there, and I didn't see you walk up, and... whew.
Who is it you mistake me for?
We don't have a name for him. I've only heard cries over the comms about a lone killer with a lightsaber massacring my workers.
Calm yourself. I wish to know more about your problem.
Sorry, we're all more than a little rattled.
Tell me why you're so afraid, wretch--or I'll give you something worth fearing.
I, uh--of course.
Did headquarters actually post a bounty? I guess the Imperials and Republic couldn't be bothered to help us.
Heard something about a Kaleesh on a rampage. Caught my interest.
It's been a massacre. He's killed dozens of our workers.
No bounty I know about, but it sounded like you were in trouble.
Oh, I, umm... glad you're here then.
Sounded awful desperate on that distress call. I love desperate in a client.
Uhhh, right. Reassuring... no, this is a blessing. It's a blessing.... We'll work something out if you can stop this lunatic.
Are you... military? Please tell me you aren't with that killer....
My allegiance really isn't important. I heard your distress call.
Take a breath. I'm here to help you.
Just you? I... no, never mind. I'm sure you know what you're doing.
That may very well depend. Is this a Republic operation?
No... we're with Minos-Mestra Corporation. We've secured mining rights for Ilum from both the Republic and the Sith Empire. Not a cheap arrangement.
Things were going well, more or less, until a few weeks ago. Stopped getting word from a few of our camps.
Then we started finding the bodies. Hacked to pieces. Nothing else touched. His only motive seems to be to hurt us.
Any clue as to how I might find the killer?
I don't think waiting for him to turn up again is an option.
Our camps are all over this ice ball, it'd be dumb luck if he struck again right where you happen to be.
This sounds like an act of vengeance. Any idea how you made this enemy?
No, none!
It started around the time we broke ground on shaft sixteen. Probably a coincidence, but maybe there's something there we don't know about?
I'll investigate. It's as close to a lead as we have from the sound of things.
I'll mark shaft sixteen on your map.
Please be careful. This guy won't think twice about trying to kill you if you cross paths.
[Refuse Quest] I can't go on a wild bantha chase right now.
So, you're not going to help? Oh, we're doomed.
Ah! Don't sneak up on me! There's a killer on the loose.
[Reject Companion] I was sent for a possible recruit. But I don't want you in my Alliance.
[Reject Companion] You have become weak in my absence. I'll have nothing more to do with you.
[Kill Xalek] You have failed me for the last time, apprentice.
This doesn't have to be the end for you.
We... we won't trouble you! Please, just leave us in peace!
[Imprison Xalek] I can't leave you roaming free.
You even deny me death....
[Imprison Xalek] I won't execute you. But you can't roam free.
Why I came doesn't matter. I can't leave you unpunished for the miners' deaths.
